001package org.biopax.paxtools.pattern.miner;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.controller.PathAccessor;
004import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
005import org.biopax.paxtools.model.level3.Entity;
006import org.biopax.paxtools.model.level3.Level3Element;
007import org.biopax.paxtools.model.level3.Pathway;
008import org.biopax.paxtools.model.level3.PublicationXref;
009
010import java.util.*;
011import java.util.logging.Level;
012
013/**
014 * @author Ozgun Babur
015 */
016public class SIFInteraction implements Comparable
017{
018        public Set<BioPAXElement> sourceERs;
019        public Set<BioPAXElement> targetERs;
020        public Set<BioPAXElement> sourcePEs;
021        public Set<BioPAXElement> targetPEs;
022        public String sourceID;
023        public String targetID;
024        public SIFType type;
025        public Set<BioPAXElement> mediators;
026
027        public SIFInteraction(String sourceID, String targetID, BioPAXElement sourceER,
028                BioPAXElement targetER, SIFType type, Set<BioPAXElement> mediators,
029                Set<BioPAXElement> sourcePEs, Set<BioPAXElement> targetPEs)
030        {
031                this.sourceID = sourceID;
032                this.targetID = targetID;
033                this.sourceERs = new HashSet<BioPAXElement>();
034                this.targetERs = new HashSet<BioPAXElement>();
035
036                this.sourceERs.add(sourceER);
037                this.targetERs.add(targetER);
038                this.type = type;
039
040                this.mediators = mediators;
041                this.sourcePEs = sourcePEs;
042                this.targetPEs = targetPEs;
043        }
044
045        public boolean hasIDs()
046        {
047                return sourceID != null && targetID != null;
048        }
049
050        @Override
051        public int hashCode()
052        {
053                return sourceID.hashCode() + targetID.hashCode() + type.hashCode();
054        }
055
056        @Override
057        public boolean equals(Object obj)
058        {
059                if (obj instanceof SIFInteraction)
060                {
061                        SIFInteraction i = (SIFInteraction) obj;
062
063                        return i.type.equals(type) && i.sourceID.equals(sourceID) && i.targetID.equals(targetID);
064                }
065
066                return false;
067        }
068
069        @Override
070        public int compareTo(Object o)
071        {
072                if (o instanceof SIFInteraction)
073                {
074                        SIFInteraction i = (SIFInteraction) o;
075
076                        return (sourceID + targetID + type.getTag()).compareTo(
077                                i.sourceID + i.targetID + i.type.getTag());
078                }
079
080                return 0;
081        }
082
083        /**
084         * Merges publications of the parameter equivalent sif with this one.
085         * @param equivalent the equivalent sif interaction to get its publications.
086         */
087        public void mergeWith(SIFInteraction equivalent)
088        {
089                if (!this.equals(equivalent))
090                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("SIF interactions are not equivalent.");
091
092                sourceERs.addAll(equivalent.sourceERs);
093                targetERs.addAll(equivalent.targetERs);
094
095                sourcePEs.addAll(equivalent.sourcePEs);
096                targetPEs.addAll(equivalent.targetPEs);
097
098                if (mediators == null) mediators = equivalent.mediators;
099                else if (equivalent.mediators != null)
100                {
101                        mediators.addAll(equivalent.mediators);
102                }
103        }
104
105        @Override
106        public String toString()
107        {
108                return sourceID + "\t" + type.getTag() + "\t" + targetID;
109        }
110
111        /**
112         * Collects IDs of mediators.
113         * @return mediator IDs
114         */
115        public List<String> getMediatorIDs()
116        {
117                List<String> ids = new ArrayList<String>(mediators.size());
118
119                for (BioPAXElement ele : mediators)
120                {
121                        ids.add(ele.getUri());
122                }
123                return ids;
124        }
125
126        /**
127         * Gets the mediator IDs in a String with a space between each ID.
128         *
129         * @return mediator IDs joined with spaces.
130         */
131        public String getMediatorsInString()
132        {
133                String m = "";
134                for (String mid : getMediatorIDs())
135                {
136                        m+= " " + mid;
137                }
138                return m.trim().replaceAll(" ", ";");
139        }
140
141        /**
142         * Collects Pubmed or PMC ids
143         * @return publication IDs
144         */
145        public List<String> getPublicationIDs(boolean pubmed)
146        {
147                if (mediators == null) return Collections.emptyList();
148
149                Set<PublicationXref> xrefs = harvestPublicationXrefs(mediators.toArray(new BioPAXElement[mediators.size()]));
150                Set<String> set = pubmed ? harvestPMIDs(xrefs) : harvestPMCIDs(xrefs);
151
152                List<String> list = new ArrayList<String>(set);
153                Collections.sort(list);
154
155                return list;
156        }
157
158        private static final PathAccessor xrefAcc = new PathAccessor("XReferrable/xref:PublicationXref");
159        private static final PathAccessor evidAcc = new PathAccessor("Observable/evidence/xref:PublicationXref");
160
161        /**
162         * Collects publication xrefs of the given elements.
163         * @param ele element array
164         * @return publication xrefs
165         */
166        private Set<PublicationXref> harvestPublicationXrefs(BioPAXElement... ele)
167        {
168                Set<PublicationXref> set = new HashSet<PublicationXref>();
169
170                for (Object o : xrefAcc.getValueFromBeans(Arrays.asList(ele)))
171                {
172                        set.add((PublicationXref) o);
173                }
174                for (Object o : evidAcc.getValueFromBeans(Arrays.asList(ele)))
175                {
176                        set.add((PublicationXref) o);
177                }
178                return set;
179        }
180
181        /**
182         * Collects PubMed IDs from the given publication xrefs.
183         * @param xrefs publication xrefs
184         * @return PMIDs
185         */
186        private Set<String> harvestPMIDs(Set<PublicationXref> xrefs)
187        {
188                return harvestXrefs(xrefs, "pubmed");
189        }
190
191        /**
192         * Collects PubMed Central IDs from the given publication xrefs.
193         * @param xrefs publication xrefs
194         * @return PMIDs
195         */
196        private Set<String> harvestPMCIDs(Set<PublicationXref> xrefs)
197        {
198                return harvestXrefs(xrefs, "PMC International");
199        }
200
201        /**
202         * Collects things from given xrefs.
203         * @param xrefs
204         * @return whatever collected
205         */
206        private Set<String> harvestXrefs(Set<PublicationXref> xrefs, String dbID)
207        {
208                Set<String> set = new HashSet<String>();
209
210                for (PublicationXref xref : xrefs)
211                {
212                        if (xref.getDb() != null && xref.getDb().equalsIgnoreCase(dbID))
213                                if (xref.getId() != null && !xref.getId().isEmpty())
214                                        set.add(xref.getId());
215                }
216                return set;
217        }
218
219        private static final PathAccessor[] pathwayAcc = new PathAccessor[]{
220                new PathAccessor("Interaction/pathwayComponentOf"),
221                new PathAccessor("Complex/participantOf/pathwayComponentOf"),
222                new PathAccessor("Complex/componentOf*/participantOf/pathwayComponentOf"),
223                new PathAccessor("Complex/memberPhysicalEntityOf*/participantOf/pathwayComponentOf"),
224                new PathAccessor("Interaction/stepProcessOf/pathwayOrderOf"),
225                new PathAccessor("Complex/participantOf/stepProcessOf/pathwayOrderOf"),
226                new PathAccessor("Complex/componentOf*/participantOf/stepProcessOf/pathwayOrderOf"),
227                new PathAccessor("Complex/memberPhysicalEntityOf*/participantOf/stepProcessOf/pathwayOrderOf"),
228                // Note that these PathAccessors are probably not sufficient for accurate navigation from a Complex
229                // to the nearest Pathways that contain it. '*' means - to apply the property recursively (e.g.,
230                // if a component of a complex is complex, get its components as well, and so on.)
231        };
232
233        /**
234         * Collects Pathway objects that the Interactions among the mediators are members.
235         * @return related pathways
236         */
237        public Set<Pathway> getPathways()
238        {
239                Set<Pathway> set = new HashSet<Pathway>();
240
241                for (PathAccessor pAcc : pathwayAcc)
242                {
243                        for (Object o : pAcc.getValueFromBeans(mediators))
244                        {
245                                set.add((Pathway) o);
246                        }
247                }
248
249                return set;
250        }
251
252        /**
253         * Collects the names of the related pathways.
254         * @return pathway names
255         */
256        public List<String> getPathwayNames()
257        {
258                Set<Pathway> set = getPathways();
259                List<String> names = new ArrayList<String>();
260
261                for (Pathway p : set)
262                {
263                        String name = p.getDisplayName();
264                        if (!names.contains(name)) names.add(name);
265                }
266
267                Collections.sort(names);
268                return names;
269        }
270
271        /**
272         * Collects the related pathway URIs.
273         * @return URIs
274         */
275        public List<String> getPathwayUris()
276        {
277                List<String> uris = new ArrayList<String>();
278                for (Pathway p : getPathways()) {
279                        String uri = p.getUri();
280                        if (!uris.contains(uri)) uris.add(uri);
281                }
282                Collections.sort(uris);
283                return uris;
284        }
285
286        private static final PathAccessor dataSourceAcc = new PathAccessor("Entity/dataSource/displayName");
287
288        /**
289         * Collects data source names (Provenance display names) of mediators.
290         * @return related data sources
291         */
292        public Set<String> getDataSources()
293        {
294                Set<String> set = new HashSet<String>();
295
296                for (Object o : dataSourceAcc.getValueFromBeans(mediators))
297                {
298                        set.add((String) o);
299                }
300
301                return set;
302        }
303
304        private static final PathAccessor locAcc = new PathAccessor("PhysicalEntity/cellularLocation/term");
305
306        /**
307         * Collects cellular location terms of target objects.
308         * @return cellular locations
309         */
310        public Set<String> getCellularLocationsOfTarget()
311        {
312                return getCellularLocations(targetPEs);
313        }
314
315        /**
316         * Collects cellular location terms of source objects.
317         * @return cellular locations
318         */
319        public Set<String> getCellularLocationsOfSource()
320        {
321                return getCellularLocations(sourcePEs);
322        }
323
324        /**
325         * Collects cellular location terms of related objects.
326         * @return cellular locations
327         */
328        private Set<String> getCellularLocations(Set<BioPAXElement> eles)
329        {
330                Set<String> set = new HashSet<String>();
331
332                for (Object o : locAcc.getValueFromBeans(eles))
333                {
334                        set.add((String) o);
335                }
336
337                return set;
338        }
339
340        /**
341         * Collects comments strings of mediator objects.
342         * @return comments
343         */
344        public Set<String> getMediatorComments()
345        {
346                Set<String> comments = new HashSet<String>();
347                for (BioPAXElement med : mediators)
348                {
349                        if (med instanceof Level3Element) comments.addAll(((Level3Element) med).getComment());
350                }
351                return comments;
352        }
353
354        //---- Section: Static methods ----------------------------------------------------------------|
355
356        /**
357         * Collects and sorts sourceID and targetID of the given collection of sif interactions.
358         * @param sifInts interactions to consider
359         * @param type types of interest, all types accepted if empty
360         * @return sorted source and target IDS
361         */
362        public static List<String> getSortedGeneNames(Collection<SIFInteraction> sifInts,
363                SIFType... type)
364        {
365                Set<String> genes = new HashSet<String>();
366                Set<SIFType> types = new HashSet<SIFType>(Arrays.asList(type));
367
368                // collect gene names
369
370                for (SIFInteraction sifInt : sifInts)
371                {
372                        if (!types.isEmpty() && !types.contains(sifInt.type)) continue;
373
374                        genes.add(sifInt.sourceID);
375                        genes.add(sifInt.targetID);
376                }
377
378                // sort all gene names
379
380                List<String> names = new ArrayList<String>(genes);
381                Collections.sort(names);
382
383                return names;
384        }
385
386        /**
387         * Converts the given collection of interactions into an adjacency matrix.
388         * @param sifInts interactions to consider
389         * @param type types of interest, all types accepted if empty
390         * @return the sif network as adjacency matrix
391         */
392        public static boolean[][] convertToAdjacencyMatrix(Collection<SIFInteraction> sifInts,
393                SIFType... type)
394        {
395                Set<SIFType> types = new HashSet<SIFType>(Arrays.asList(type));
396
397                // collect gene names
398                List<String> names = getSortedGeneNames(sifInts, type);
399
400                // record name indexes for efficient lookup
401
402                Map<String, Integer> name2ind = new HashMap<String, Integer>();
403                int i = 0;
404                for (String name : names)
405                {
406                        name2ind.put(name, i++);
407                }
408
409                // generate adjacency matrix
410
411                boolean[][] matrix = new boolean[names.size()][names.size()];
412                for (boolean[] m : matrix) Arrays.fill(m, false);
413
414                for (SIFInteraction sifInt : sifInts)
415                {
416                        if (!types.isEmpty() && !types.contains(sifInt.type)) continue;
417
418                        matrix[name2ind.get(sifInt.sourceID)][name2ind.get(sifInt.targetID)] = true;
419
420                        if (!sifInt.type.isDirected())
421                        {
422                                matrix[name2ind.get(sifInt.targetID)][name2ind.get(sifInt.sourceID)] = true;
423                        }
424                }
425
426                return matrix;
427        }
428}
